issue.title: (Bug report) Sync fails on windows system, but not on linux (ubuntu)
issue.body:
### Trilium Version

0.60.4

### What operating system are you using?

Windows, Ubuntu

### What is your setup?

Local + server sync

### Operating System Version

Windows 11, Ubuntu 20.4lts

### Description

I have set up a server today and have successfully connected my ubuntu trilium client to the server. It syncs completely fine. However, i have problems with my Windows setup. Using the exact same parameters (which i, after some trying, copied over from my ubuntu setup), i can't access the server. The error states:
```
20:59:19.909 Received request to trigger sync now.
20:59:19.909 Sending message to all clients: {"type":"sync-pull-in-progress","lastSyncedPush":20233}
20:59:19.976 sync failed: Request to POST https://<DOMAIN>:8080/api/login/sync failed, error: 401 Unauthorized
stack: Error: Request to POST https://<DOMAIN>:8080/api/login/sync failed, error: 401 Unauthorized
    at generateError (C:\Program Files (x86)\Trilium\resources\app.asar\src\services\request.js:191:12)
    at ClientRequest.<anonymous> (C:\Program Files (x86)\Trilium\resources\app.asar\src\services\request.js:62:28)
    at ClientRequest.emit (node:events:394:28)
    at SimpleURLLoaderWrapper.<anonymous> (node:electron/js2c/browser_init:101:6816)
    at SimpleURLLoaderWrapper.emit (node:events:394:28)
    at SimpleURLLoaderWrapper.callbackTrampoline (node:internal/async_hooks:130:17)
20:59:19.977 Slow 200 POST /api/sync/now with 136 bytes took 68ms
```

I've searched for a while in the issues and the forum, but still i can't explain why the ubuntu trilium desktop instance works and the windows one doesn't.

### Error logs

_No response_

issue.title: (Bug report) Sync fails on windows system, but not on linux (ubuntu)
issue.body:
### Trilium Version

0.60.4

### What operating system are you using?

Windows, Ubuntu

### What is your setup?

Local + server sync

### Operating System Version

Windows 11, Ubuntu 20.4lts

### Description

I have set up a server today and have successfully connected my ubuntu trilium client to the server. It syncs completely fine. However, i have problems with my Windows setup. Using the exact same parameters (which i, after some trying, copied over from my ubuntu setup), i can't access the server. The error states:
```
20:59:19.909 Received request to trigger sync now.
20:59:19.909 Sending message to all clients: {"type":"sync-pull-in-progress","lastSyncedPush":20233}
20:59:19.976 sync failed: Request to POST https://<DOMAIN>:8080/api/login/sync failed, error: 401 Unauthorized
stack: Error: Request to POST https://<DOMAIN>:8080/api/login/sync failed, error: 401 Unauthorized
    at generateError (C:\Program Files (x86)\Trilium\resources\app.asar\src\services\request.js:191:12)
    at ClientRequest.<anonymous> (C:\Program Files (x86)\Trilium\resources\app.asar\src\services\request.js:62:28)
    at ClientRequest.emit (node:events:394:28)
    at SimpleURLLoaderWrapper.<anonymous> (node:electron/js2c/browser_init:101:6816)
    at SimpleURLLoaderWrapper.emit (node:events:394:28)
    at SimpleURLLoaderWrapper.callbackTrampoline (node:internal/async_hooks:130:17)
20:59:19.977 Slow 200 POST /api/sync/now with 136 bytes took 68ms
```

I've searched for a while in the issues and the forum, but still i can't explain why the ubuntu trilium desktop instance works and the windows one doesn't.

### Error logs

_No response_

issue.title: input cursor always positioned in the center of the screen
issue.body:
### Describe feature

If I could have the input cursor always positioned in the center of the screen, that would be ideal, meaning that as I input, the screen would scroll automatically.
thank you 

### Additional Information

_No response_

issue.title: (Feature request) Allow Expanding Notes Via API
issue.body:
### Describe feature

Hi. I'm trying to create a script so that notes with an #alwaysExpanded label are automatically expanded when their parents are visible in the tree. However, there doesn't seem to be an API function to expand said notes.

### Additional Information

_No response_

comment.body: Essentially i want to create a script that automatically expands the children for a note with  a label like #alwaysExpanded

forkee.name: trilium
forkee.description: Build your personal knowledge base with Trilium Notes

issue.title: (Feature request) Allow Expanding Notes Via API
issue.body:
### Describe feature

Hi. I'm trying to create a script so that notes with an #alwaysExpanded label are automatically expanded when their parents are visible in the tree. However, there doesn't seem to be an API function to expand said notes.

### Additional Information

_No response_

comment.body: It's just a REST API so you could use `fetch` or similar I believe, but generally if you're already in a frontend/backend script there's probably a better way to do what you're trying to do.

_No response_

comment.body: How do i access ETAPI from within a backend script?

issue.title: Question: How do I prevent correcting characters to symbols?
issue.body:
Hi,

Thank you for great software!

I don't want Trilium to change:

+ three dots `...` to `…` symbol 
+ two dashes `--` to `–` symbol
+ `->` to `→` symbol

etc

How do I prevent this? 
Thanks!
BR

issue.title: Paid Hosting
issue.body:
## Edit: I launched! Visit https://trilium.cc/paid-hosting for more info.

It would be on a subdomain, so "example.trilium.com" (example domain; I don't own trilium.com). You could use it to access your Trilium instance wherever on the web, and as a secondary sync location/backup; in addition, thanks to the new [sharing feature](https://github.com/zadam/trilium/wiki/Sharing), you can use it to share your notes as a small website!!

The costs are actually not that high depending on how many people are interested, I just want to gauge interest in it for now. **How much would you pay for such a service?** Keep in mind the goal isn't profit, but more running a community service; **I plan on donating some of the profit left over after the costs to zadam** (if there's enough interest in it to even cover costs ●︿●).

Some details:

* Fully encrypted offsite backups 
* If you're worried about server access, you can encrypt all of your notes very easily; obviously, I would take security very seriously and not read anyone else's notes, but math is stronger than a pinky promise.
* You would be able to use it without a desktop client at all. The URL + login is all that is needed to access the web app. You could, however, choose to install the desktop app as well and sync with it that way. This provides more flexibility as you don't need to have internet access to save local changes (synced whenever the connection allows)

The cost will probably be very affordable (think ***$2-3 a month***, possibly up-front for 6-12 months to pay for initial costs) but I'll give discounts for a few reasons (student, teacher, contributor to Trilium, extenuating circumstances).

**If you have any questions at all, please feel free to reply or shoot me an email (admin@matthew.science)**. Whether I do it is completely dependent on whether/how many would be willing to use it, so let me know sooner rather than later :)

comment.body: been having a similar issue on my end - hope it gets resolved soon! it's been very stable up until about a week ago
